definition: to flatter/to toady
flatter
prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]
abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]
to flatter
flattering and fawning (idiom)/sweet-talking

sentences.english: When he saw me, he took off his hat with an air of gorgeous servility .
sentences.chinese: 他看到我，脱掉帽子，满脸都是阿谀的神色。

sentences.english: Jack bootlicked to get a promotion;
sentences.chinese: 杰克阿谀奉承以得到晋升。

sentences.english: A wise man is superior to flattery.
sentences.chinese: 一个智者是不会被阿谀奉承所迷惑的。

sentences.english: I cannot be your friend and your flatterer too.
sentences.chinese: 我不能既是你的朋友，而又对你阿谀奉承。

sentences.english: A great man is above flattery.
sentences.chinese: 一个伟大的人是不屑于阿谀奉承的。

sentences.english: The flattery monacal is a philatelic.
sentences.chinese: 那个阿谀的修道士是个集邮爱好者。

sentences.english: Flattery brings friends, but the truth begets enmity.
sentences.chinese: 阿谀奉承也许能交到朋友，但真相会引起憎恨。

sentences.english: I could not be ywe friend or ywe eventerer too.
sentences.chinese: 朋友无所不能阿谀奉承。
她以阿谀奉承博得宠幸。

sentences.english: Sycophancy was the device of the least trustworthy.
sentences.chinese: 阿谀奉承之辈最不可靠。

sentences.english: However, the Sagittarius woman is not the one who believes in flattery.
sentences.chinese: 但是，射手座的女人却不相信阿谀奉承这一套。

sentences.english: He despised people who were lavish with their praises .
sentences.chinese: 他看不起那些阿谀奉承的人。

sentences.english: The implication is to curry favour, benefits from fish.
sentences.chinese: 阿谀奉承，其言外之意就是要从中捞取好处。

sentences.english: Forum-Ergebnisse für "I cannot be your friend and your flatterer too."
sentences.chinese: 我不能同时是你的朋友又是你的阿谀奉承者。

definition: flattering and fawning (idiom)/sweet-talking
to fawn on/to flatter/to ingratiate oneself/flattery
to fawn on/to ingratiate oneself/(literary) to meet face to face
to flatter
to smooth whiskers and pat a horse's bottom (idiom); to use flatter to get what one wants/to toady/boot-licking
to ingratiate oneself with/to pander to
(honorific) to greet/to fawn
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
to bow down to everything sb says or does/to act submissively in order to ingratiate oneself
servile and bending the knee (idiom); fawning/bending and scraping to curry favor
flattering words
to flatter/to fawn on/to butter sb up/toadying/bootlicking
to be glib in one's speech and wear an ingratiating expression (idiom)
to resort to bragging and flattering
toady/bootlicker
to sing sb's praises (mostly derogatory)
